content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis with velocity given by <math> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </math> for time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≥</mo> <mn>0.</mn> </mrow> </math> If the particle is at position <math> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mo>-</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math> at time t = 0, what is the position of the particle at the time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>?</mo> </mrow> </math>

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
